topics.body:
So apparently Intel is planning on spending $300000000 for minorities in the tech industry; that's cool that they're going to spend that on promot. . . 
*reads it and realizes that not a single penny is going towards scholarships and such*
*facedesk*
God damn it.
Not to drag drama into this or such, but why is it that every single fucking time a large scale business talks about "promoting minorities" in high tech and skilled labor fields do they forget the important the most important thing of in order for minorities to get a job in say for example brain surgery the individual has to go to college first?  Where exactly do all these idiot CEOs think people learn this stuff?  Do they think people learn how to perform brain surgery in their garage or such?

The sad thing is I have known people like this before where they don't understand that high tech fields require college and such.  "Durr hurr you should types thems thingies and makes the computers do the things".

If you're wondering what their "genius" plan consists of it's more bureaucratic crap, lobbying groups, associations and such and no mention of scholarships. . . God these people are stupid.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54acaba663687249f70f0200#post_54acaba663687249f70f0200
Not really; the problem with a lot of rich people, no offense to anyone, is that people like this don't understand any of the logistics and only know the monetary side.

To put it simply:
Most bosses in the tech industry, "My computer is saying to press any key to continue; where is the any key?"
Tech, ". . .(seriously?) Press any key"
"That's what I'm asking about; this keyboard doesn't have a any key"


For example the only reason why say Apple or Microsoft even got on the map was because of Steve Jobs and Bill Gates and now that they're out of the picture their respective companies are making a bunch of extremely long term dumb decisions cause the people now in charge don't understand how to do the job.

It's also why you have so many dumb tech products cause the people at the top simply don't understand anything about the actual going ons.  Call me crazy but I actually welcome the automazation of companies' structure going on because simply put most tech companies are ran by people that don't understand technology.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
